etymologies: mid 19th century: from buck ‘body of a cart’ (perhaps a variant of obsolete bouk ‘belly, body’) + board

definitions: an open, four-wheeled, horse-drawn carriage with seating that is attached to a plank stretching between the front and rear axles.
shortDefinitions: open horse-drawn carriage with four wheels and seating that is attached to plank stretching between front and rear axles
